txt.en: 'I heard and saw nothing... I swear it!'
'I never liked either one of them to begin with... I am only here to watch the fight.'
Instance: Troubled Friendship
'I am pretty sure I saw someone playing with Sperling's sword down in the southern part of the city, but it was not Brunstan.'
'If Brunstan stole Sperling's sword, he should be fed to the Orcs. Sperling's da gave him the sword before he went away....'
This child confessed to misplacing Sperling's toy sword
'Oh, you must hurry, kind [placeholder]! Brunstan and Sperling will surely harm each other if they continue fighting!'
TBD
'Oh dear, you say that another of my friends was actually to blame for the loss of Sperling's sword? Oh my....'
TBD
Talk to Getfleda.

'Oh my! I do not know who to believe! I cannot believe that Brunstan would be so dishonourable, but I also do not believe that Sperling would accuse him without cause!\n\n'Perhaps one of the other children saw something... would you ask them?'
Talk to Brunstan and Sperling.

'Sperling has accused me of stealing the toy sword his father gave him, but I tell you I did not! I am no dishonourable dog that would steal from his friends!\n\n'Sperling lent me the sword, and I returned it... I swear it! He only blames me because he does not want to blame himself for the loss of it.'
Talk to Getfleda and let her know what her friends had to say.
Talk to the children observing the fight between Brunstan and Sperling and learn if any of them saw what happened.
Talk to Getfleda.
Talk to Getfleda
Hear Brunstan's side of the story
Hear Sperling's side of the story
Talk to Getfleda
Talk to the children observing the fight between Brunstan and Sperling
Talk to Getfleda

'Brunstan is a liar and a thief! My father gave me a wooden practice sword before he went away to fight, and I let Brunstan play with it... now it is gone.\n\n'He swears that he returned it to me, but I swear he did not! He is a liar without honour!'
'Let us talk somewhere else....'
You have accompanied Getfleda, a girl of Eaworth, to help break up a fight between two of her friends, Brunstan and Sperling.
'There, see? Can you stop them?'

'N-nay, I saw nothing! I-I....'

The child sighs and looks distraught.

'I cannot tell a lie. I borrowed the sword from Brunstan and was playing in the burned yards to the south. When my mother called me to dinner, I forgot the toy and left it behind. When I went back, I could not find it again.

'Please, do not tell Sperling and Brunstan! They are both bigger than me!'
